newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia Sakha republic picks rating agencies in Sep. [CORRECTED 08:53 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Russia Sakha republic picks rating agencies in Sep. [CORRECTED 08:53 GMT]

text.p: Russia's Sakha republic (Yakutia) plans to choose rating agencies in September for its Eurobond issue (corrects syntax to clarify that the rating agencies will be chosen in September but the actual Eurobond launch will be later), and after the rating is ready will choose lead-managers, a republic official said on Monday.
"Now we are busy with a credit rating," Sakha's deputy premier Sergei Yanygin told Reuters. "After we are done with it, we shall think of the lead-managers."
He said rating data would be ready by September, when the region planned to choose rating agencies and pass them the documents.
Previously, he said Sakha would choose lead-managers by the end of June.
Yanygin said falling yields on the international bond market might prompt the region to make a small issue to get an interntional credit history.
He said the volume of the issue was not yet set.
Previously, he said the republic planned to make several Eurobond issues.
